After a night year of construction, and drinking beer testing, this liquid engine is nearly same as was ideal.

I has a 25% lot more power, and little fuel consumption. Also its ugly cute%)

For ONLY 99.99kk !

Hah, im exausted after a night of war with all that.

And yeah! HELLO EVERYONE!

Mine is the drill that will PIECE THE HEAVENS! *Watches Jebediah go TTGL on Kerbal.* 8)

Either that, or else the thing is drunk, not sure which.

My english is poor so i just understand last words
Kick logic to the curb and read the illegible! That's the way the Kerbal Space Program Forums do things!

Small problem: When I attach it to my rocket, and activate its stage, it doesn't produce any flame fx, sounds, or thrust of any kind. Any ideas?

Edit: Wow. Okay. I didn't realize you actually had to have a fuel tank attached for a liquid fuel engine to do anything.

My english is poor so i just understand last words

He's making a reference to the anime Tengen Toppa Guren Lagan (TTGL).

This is very nice. It's powerful and efficient. I made it to around 630,000 meters at around 6,250 m/s before I ran out of fuel. This was the only engine on my craft, with the single parachute, one liquid fuel tank, the escape tower mod, and 4 wings.
Fantastic mod, rocket works great. Only problem ive found is that they're too large to fit onto a tri-coupler.

Fantastic mod, rocket works great. Only problem ive found is that they're too large to fit onto a tri-coupler.

You know what that means right? That's right... it's time for larger tri-couplers.
make more spiraly parts, please, I want to pierce the heavens owo
I see someone's been shoving fuel tanks in the blender!!! Other than that, I love it. looks really nice.

..shoving fuel tanks in the blender..

You mean making them right? :3 lol

Mine is the drill that will PIECE THE HEAVENS! *Watches Jebediah go TTGL on Kerbal.* 8)

Either that, or else the thing is drunk, not sure which.

Now I want uncouplers to be Lagann faces and the cockpits to be drills...
Looks awesome, it test it!

Handles great and looks great on it's own. But it doesn't like teamwork at all. It's just an itsy bitsy bit too wide to work with any standard-sized structure. It's still great though (and dear god it feels awesome having a rocket soar through the air without the rumble of standard engines once in a while. Just the whisper of air around the rocket...)

This is a beautiful and unique engine. It\'s a shame it hasn\'t got more recognition. The common bell-shaped rocket motor is realistic, but boring. See two, you\'ve seen them both. This one is really set apart!

This is a beautiful and unique engine. It\'s a shame it hasn\'t got more recognition. The common bell-shaped rocket motor is realistic, but boring. See two, you\'ve seen them both. This one is really set apart!

The guy who posted this hasn\'t even logged in for more than 3 months-why can\'t people look at dates?

EDIT:

Tim, look at the Post date-18th July 2011.

Whoa whoa wait, wasn\'t this a really, really old part from like july/august?

On the KSR site I believe?
All it says to me is 'Look, I can use the Twist modifier!'

All it says to me is 'Look, I can use the Twist modifier!'

To be fair, it was made when KSP was less than a month old.

To be fair, it was made when KSP was less than a month old.

I like the model, but I think it would look better without the silly twist
Perhaps straighten it, but add a coil of cable around it somewhere. The spiral is a nice idea, just needs more cleaning up.
Does anyone know how someone would go about getting the texture to work on this?
